revised_title: Osmotic Permeability Measurements in Insect Malpighian Tubules
tldr: The authors developed an improved method to measure osmotic permeability in the Malpighian tubules of the insect Rhodnius prolixus. They found that osmotic permeability in the lower Malpighian tubule decreases, preventing water movements accompanying 5-HT-stimulated potassium chloride resorption. This study provides insights into the mechanisms of fluid secretion by transporting epithelia in insects.
